defs: any of a number of large birds of prey with a naked, usu. brightly colored head and dark plumage, which feed chiefly or entirely on carrion.
an East Indian grass (akin to Vetiveria zizanioides).
a plantain tree bearing small fruit of dark colour (from 200 to 400 in a bunch).
the part of a bridle that goes into a horse's mouth, used to control the horse; a bit.
a kind of weapon.
a man who writes poems or verses; a poet.
a man taking ideas, passages, entire work, etc. from another and pass them off as one's own; plagiarism.
(pl.) poets; (sing.) a poet without extraordinary talent.
a woman who composes poetry; a woman poet; a poetess.
a malleable, ductile, metallic chemical element that can be readily magnetised, rusts rapidly in moist or salty air, and is vital to plant and animal life, symbol, Fe; iron.

ಕಬ್ಬಿಣದ ಕಡಲೆ kabbiṇada kaḍale that which is too hard to understand or to deal with; ಕಬ್ಬಿಣ ಕಾದಿರುವಾಗಲೇ ಬಗ್ಗಿಸಬೇಕು kabbiṇa kādiruvāglē baggisabēku take the advantage by acting promptly seizing the opportunity; strike while the iron is hot; ಕಬ್ಬಿಣದ ಗಾಣ ಸವಿಯುವುದೇ ಕಬ್ಬಿನಹಾಲ ಸವಿಯ? kabbiṇada gāṇa saviyuvudē kabbina hāla saviya for appreciating good things, one must have taste for that.
the reddish-brown or reddish-yellow coating formed on iron or steel by oxidation, as during exposure to air and moisture: it consists mainly of ferric oxide and ferric hydroxide; rust.
the tree Sideroxylon tomentosum ( = Xantolistomentosa) of Sapotaceae family; iron wood.
a man who hunts or catches wild animals, birds, etc. for food or for a living; a huntsman.
a man who fishes for a living ; a fisherman.

ಕಬ್ಬಿನ ತೋಟಕ್ಕೆ ಆನೆ ನುಗ್ಗಿದ ಹಾಗೆ kabbina tōṭakke āne nuggida hāge (simile) behaving roughly and enjoying at some place, but ruining the same; ಕಬ್ಬಿನ ಹೊಟ್ಟೆಯಲ್ಲಿ ಸೂಲಂಗಿ ಹುಟ್ಟಿದ ಹಾಗೆ kabbina hoṭṭeyalli sūlangi huṭṭida hāge (proverbial simile) it is like being an useless son who bring shame to his parentś reputation; ಕಬ್ಬು ಡೊಂಕಾದರೆ ಸವಿ ಡೊಂಕೆ? kabbu ḍonkādare savi ḍonke? essence is independent of the outer form;Crooked logs make straight fires;a deformed body may have a beautiful soul; ಕಬ್ಬು ಸಿಹಿಯೆಂದು ಬುಡದವರೆಗೂ ಅಗಿಯಬಾರದು kabbusihiyendu buḍadavaregū agiyabāradu do not take undue advantage of a person simply he or she is good; the orange that too hard squeezed yields bitter juice.
